subject: concurrent maintenance: handle pdrs after cm
commitMessage:
concurrent maintenance: handle pdrs after cm

This commit rearranges the PDRs and the entity association tree
after a CM operation.

Change-Id: I800a6e8966450528c2aeffe9fcc7ed0e17347148
Signed-off-by: Sampa Misra <sampmisr@in.ibm.com>

Why is that necessary?  Also "CM" is probably an IBMism that we should avoid.  Maybe "firmware assisted hot-plug" would be better (although that is a lot more typing :-(

This is an interface change on a shared library, correct?  Don't we need a version bump?

https://tldp.org/HOWTO/Program-Library-HOWTO/shared-libraries.html

It looks to me like both libpldm and libpldmresponder are just using the version of the overall pldm (meson) project.  That probably isn't what we want, because for example if you bump the project version to deal with this interface change, you'll also be bumping the version of libpldmresponder for no reason.
new line

I just searched DSP0248 and I couldn't find any references to remote or local pdrs, so I could make an attempt at understanding what the motivation is here.  Is there a different word that we could use?
